security_audit.summary: This skill contains only documentation and templates for creating generative art with p5.js. No executable code, network calls, or file operations exist. Static findings are false positives from misidentified markdown syntax and metadata references.

content.value_statement: Transform mathematical concepts into stunning visual art using algorithmic techniques. This skill provides guided templates for creating reproducible generative artwork with seeded randomness and interactive controls.
actual_capabilities: Generate p5.js code for algorithmic art with seeded randomness
Create self-contained HTML viewers with sidebar controls
Build interactive visualizations with noise fields and particle systems
Implement artwork export to PNG and SVG formats
Design responsive canvas layouts with parameter sliders
limitations: Requires p5.js library loaded from CDN
Browser-based rendering only, no server-side generation
No native support for 3D WebGL rendering

use_cases.title: Create Unique Artwork
use_cases.description: Generate one-of-a-kind visual pieces using mathematical algorithms and seeded randomness for reproducibility.

use_cases.title: Build Visualizations
use_cases.description: Create interactive data visualizations and generative art installations with customizable parameters.

use_cases.title: Prototype Patterns
use_cases.description: Quickly prototype procedural patterns for textiles, wallpapers, or branding materials.

prompt_templates.title: Basic Flow Pattern
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a generative art piece using p5.js with flowing particle patterns. Include seeded randomness for reproducibility and a sidebar with speed and density controls.

prompt_templates.title: Organic Flow Fields
prompt_templates.prompt: Generate an HTML viewer with Perlin noise field visualization. Particles should follow the noise flow creating organic turbulence patterns. Add controls for noise scale and particle count.

prompt_templates.title: Geometric Patterns
prompt_templates.prompt: Create algorithmic art based on Fibonacci sequences and golden ratios. Implement recursive geometric patterns with color gradients and complexity controls.

prompt_templates.title: Interactive Simulation
prompt_templates.prompt: Build a complex particle system with attraction and repulsion forces, trail effects, and mouse interaction. Include multiple emission sources and physics parameter controls.

output_examples.input: Create a generative art piece called 'Cosmic Dust' with swirling particle patterns
output: HTML file with embedded p5.js sketch
Sidebar controls for particle count, speed, and color mode
Download buttons for PNG and SVG export
Responsive canvas that adapts to window size

output_examples.input: Generate a noise-based flow field that creates organic river-like patterns
output: Perlin noise field calculation mapped to particle angles
Sidebar controls for noise scale and flow strength
Save artwork functionality for high-resolution export

best_practices: Always use seeded random functions (randomSeed, noiseSeed) for reproducible artwork
Implement windowResized() for responsive canvas behavior across screen sizes
Use requestAnimationFrame for smooth 60fps animations without blocking
anti_patterns: Using Math.random() instead of seeded random functions breaks reproducibility
Creating infinite loops without proper frame rate control causes browser hangs
Hard-coding canvas dimensions prevents responsive behavior on different screens

faq.question: Is this compatible with all modern browsers?
faq.answer: Yes, p5.js works in all modern browsers. Generated HTML includes CDN links for the library.

faq.question: What is the maximum canvas size supported?
faq.answer: Canvas size is limited by browser memory. For best performance, keep dimensions under 2000x2000 pixels.

faq.question: Can I embed this in my existing web project?
faq.answer: Yes, the generated HTML is self-contained and can be embedded or modified for integration.

faq.question: Is my artwork data private and secure?
faq.answer: All generation happens locally in your browser. No artwork data is sent to external servers.

faq.question: Why is my animation running slowly?
faq.answer: Reduce particle count or complexity. Use requestAnimationFrame and optimize your drawing loops.

faq.question: How does this compare to Processing?
faq.answer: p5.js is the JavaScript version of Processing, designed for web browsers with similar syntax and concepts.
